globalAttributes.name: h-color-opacity
globalAttributes.description: Set the opacity of the color

globalAttributes.name: h-color-contrast
globalAttributes.description: Set the color to the contrast from the input color

globalAttributes.name: h-color-contrast-fromBg
globalAttributes.description: Set the color to the contrast from the bgColor

globalAttributes.name: h-bgcolor-opacity
globalAttributes.description: Set the opacity of the Background-color

globalAttributes.name: h-cursor
globalAttributes.description: Utilities for controlling the cursor style when hovering over an element

globalAttributes.name: h-disabled
globalAttributes.description: Set the elemnt to disabled. opacaty in % and the pointer events to none.

globalAttributes.name: h-position
globalAttributes.description: Utilities for controlling how an element is positioned in the document

globalAttributes.name: h-top
globalAttributes.description: controlling the placement of positioned elements

globalAttributes.name: h-bottom
globalAttributes.description: controlling the placement of positioned elements

globalAttributes.name: h-left
globalAttributes.description: controlling the placement of positioned elements

globalAttributes.name: h-right
globalAttributes.description: controlling the placement of positioned elements

globalAttributes.name: h-flex-direction
globalAttributes.description: controlling the direction of flex items.

globalAttributes.name: h-flex
globalAttributes.description: controlling how flex items both grow and shrink.

globalAttributes.name: h-grid-tmp-rows
globalAttributes.description: Specifying the rows in a grid layout.

globalAttributes.name: h-grid-tmp-cols
globalAttributes.description: Specifying the columns in a grid layout.

globalAttributes.name: h-grid-col
globalAttributes.description: Specifies a grid item's size and location within a grid column by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement

globalAttributes.name: h-grid-row
globalAttributes.description: Specifies a grid item's size and location within a grid row by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement

globalAttributes.name: h-shadow
globalAttributes.description: controlling the box shadow of an element.

globalAttributes.name: h-overflow
globalAttributes.description: controlling how an element handles content that is too large for the container.

globalAttributes.name: h-overflow-x
globalAttributes.description: controlling how an element horizontal handles content that is too large for the container.

globalAttributes.name: h-overflow-y
globalAttributes.description: controlling how an element vertical handles content that is too large for the container.

globalAttributes.name: h-pointer-events
globalAttributes.description: controlling whether an element responds to pointer events.

globalAttributes.name: h-user-select
globalAttributes.description: controlling whether an element responds to pointer events.

globalAttributes.name: h-text-box-trim
globalAttributes.description: Specifies which of the over and under edges of text content to trim from a text element's block container.

globalAttributes.name: h-z-index
globalAttributes.description: controlling the stack order of an element.

globalAttributes.name: h-font-weight
globalAttributes.description: Sets the weight (or boldness) of the font.

globalAttributes.name: h-text-overflow
globalAttributes.description: Sets how hidden overflow content is signaled to users.

globalAttributes.name: h-flex-wrap
globalAttributes.description: Sets whether flex items are forced onto one line or can wrap onto multiple lines..

globalAttributes.name: h-hover-scale
globalAttributes.description: Sets the scale when hovering over an element.

values.description: place the item at grid-line 1 to grid-line 3.

values.name: 1 / span 2
values.description: place the item at grid-line 1 and span to line 3.

values.name: span 2
values.description: place the item automatic and span 2 rows.

values.name: nowrap
values.description: flex-wrap: nowrap; Default The flex items are laid out in a single line which may cause the flex container to overflow.

values.name: wrap
values.description: flex-wrap: wrap; The flex items break into multiple lines.

values.name: wrap-reverse
values.description: flex-wrap: wrap-reverse; Behaves the same as wrap, but cross-start and cross-end are inverted.

values.name: clip
values.description: text-overflow: clip; DEFAULT  will truncate the text.

values.name: ellipsis
values.description: text-overflow: ellipsis; displayed inside the content area, decreasing the amount of text displayed.

values.name: none
values.description: text-box-trim: none; The default value. No space is trimmed from the text.

values.name: trim-both
values.description: text-box-trim: trim-both; The start (over) and end (under) edges are both trimmed

values.name: trim-start
values.description: text-box-trim: trim-start; The start (over) edge is trimmed.

values.name: trim-end
values.description: text-box-trim: trim-end; The end (under) edge is trimmed.

values.name: none
values.description: user-select: none; The text of the element and its sub-elements is not selectable.

values.name: text
values.description: user-select: text; The text can be selected by the user.

values.name: all
values.description: user-select: all; The content of the element shall be selected atomically

values.name: row
values.description: flex-direction: row; position flex items horizontally in the same direction as text.

values.name: row-reverse
values.description: flex-direction: row-reverse;  position flex items horizontally in the opposite direction.

values.name: column
values.description: flex-direction: column; position flex items vertically.

values.name: column-reverse
values.description: flex-direction: column-reverse; position flex items vertically in the opposite direction

values.name: static
values.description: position: static; position an element according to the normal flow of the document.

values.name: relative
values.description: position: relative;  position an element according to the normal flow of the document

values.name: absolute
values.description: position: absolute; position an element outside of the normal flow of the document, causing neighboring elements to act as if the element doesn't exist.

values.name: fixed
values.description: position: fixed; position an element relative to the browser window

values.name: sticky
values.description: position: sticky; position an element as relative until it crosses a specified threshold, then treat it as fixed until its parent is off screen

values.name: normal
values.description: white-space: normal; Utility to cause text to wrap normally within an element. Newlines and spaces will be collapsed.

values.name: nowrap
values.description: white-space: nowrap; utility to prevent text from wrapping within an element. Newlines and spaces will be collapsed.

values.name: pre
values.description: white-space: pre; utility to preserve newlines and spaces within an element. Text will not be wrapped.

values.name: pre-line
values.description: white-space: pre-line; utility to preserve newlines but not spaces within an element. Text will be wrapped normally.

values.name: pre-wrap
values.description: white-space: pre-wrap; utility to preserve newlines and spaces within an element. Text will be wrapped normally.

values.name: break-spaces
values.description: white-space: break-spaces; utility to preserve newlines and spaces within an element. White space at the end of lines will not hang, but will wrap to the next line.
